OriginalSource.Comment: From: Busse et al., Case 19-2008: A 63-year-old HIV-positive man with cutaneous Merkel-cell carcinoma. N. Eng. J. Med. 358:2717-2723, 2008, p.2719. Removed from caption because of footnote in figure: Busse et al. Immunohistochemical Differential Diagnosis of Merkel Cell Carcinoma (Typical Staining Pattern). ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Immunohistochemical differential diagnosis of Merkel cell carcinoma (typical staining pattern: Eight-columned table depicting immunohistochemical studies useful in establishing a MCC diagnosis. Includes merkel-cell tumors, small cell carcinomas of the lung, small cell melanomas, and lymphomas;; also includes the positive or negative results of staining using cytokertain 20, cytokeratin 7, neurofilaments, neuron-specific enolases, thyroid transcription factor 1, S100 proteins, and leukocyte common antigens.

Captions.MediaCaption: Figure 4. Merkel - Immunohistochemical differential diagnosis of Merkel-Cell Carcinoma (Typical Staining Pattern).
